job_title: Patient Care Assistant (PCA) in Newburgh, NY
pros: Job security, unlimited overtime, can cover any and all shifts any time of the day with a phone call to staffing offering your assistance to make extra money. Adrenaline rush type of environment some days, and others you are in the ICU helping saving a life, other days you are sitting 1:1 with a patient -yes, paid to sit for 8 hours.
cons: Overworked, underpaid and extremely understaffed. People are applying but it’s “not in their budget.” Stop floating nurses and PCAs with little to no notice. Let us know in advance what unit we are going to so can prepare ourselves.

pros: The ability to literally touch any technology they can afford.
cons:
Most of the managers were given a 1 year class and got a masters degree from it. The lack of managerial skills is abundant and they won't admit their lack of skill which inhibits their ability to grow and become better managers.  The environment was built on this, especially in IT. 

Human Resources continued to tell me they would call me but, time after time they wouldn't and I had to reach out to them to find out what was going on.  It was very unprofessional.

Health Benefits has a crazy deductable.

There is a plan for Montefiore to fully take over in the next 5 years.  A lot of the jobs will be moved to Montefiore or eliminated.

If you just need a paycheck / somewhere to start your career go for it, otherwise look else ware.

pros: Some employees show compassion and a understanding to the horrific nature of working here.
cons: Toxic work environment. Human Resources shows favoritism towards management/admins and disregards when rules/polices are being broken. Lower level employees get taken advantage of and "Union" rules/policies are often ignored by management. Human Resources covers up any wrong doing that management has part in. Cliquey/High School atmosphere from top to bottom. Fast paced work environment due to staff shortage with no time to breath or even use the bathroom. No systems, micromanagement sets up employees for failure. It takes 10 managers to run 1 department and you will be expected to do the work of 3 people due to understaffed conditions. Union Delegates also cover up for management/admins as well when Union rules/policies are being broken. Human Resources & Union Delegates tolerate/cover up work place bullying/harassment. They will do anything to cover up any wrong doings, investigations aren't made regardless if you have witnesses. If you speak up or voice your concern to Human Resources/Union Delegates you end up getting fired.

review_title: Great Benefits but no one will notice your hard work
pros: This hospital offers great benefits if your a union worker the health benefits are amazing no complaints, great people to work with, able to move around to different positions as they become available. This is a great place to start your career in the health field.
cons: Very little room for advancement, Management doesnt appreciate your hard work, You will notice favortism towards certain employees, your expected to over backawards for "VIPS" while looking over "regular" patients.

pros: great area in cornwall, many good people to work with, mostly good management, always an opportunity to learn something new, great benefits, good education plans available
cons: low salary, low increases even when you hit the top mark, newburgh location in a bad area, many responsibilities as your job changed and you received new responsibilities the old responsibilities remained. management didn't always listen

review_title: Decent place to work. Employees are friendly.
pros: Friendly employees, most management is decent, small community hospital, thanks for doing a good job, very little micro management, good pay.
cons: Little room to move around for certain fields, outdated technology, departments can be clinquey, union is terrible, some employees have been there way too long and are too comfortable.

pros: I love to facilitate change. Be part of change and positivity both with staff abs patients, customer satisfaction.
cons: Like. Any position staffing can be challenging, but a positive. Attitude. And alittle creativity can change everything. Team players.

pros: Great medical benefits and 403b plan at a minimal cost. Your co-workers who make you feel like family. Having Joan as our CEO who was a previous RN puts an emphasis on patient care.
cons: Overall infrastructure is aging but infusion of $ into new projects like the $8 million ED renovations will help.

pros: The job itself as a PCA isn't "great". Cleaning patients head to toe is not an easy job & certainly isn't for everyone. St Lukes is a great place to work, great co workers, i was never unhappy with my job but the job of a PCA I wouldn't recommend to anyone unless your in nursing school and need the experience.
cons: Nothing negative to say about St.Lukes
